sentences.en: Dispiriting experiences like this will quickly damage the reputation of UK higher education abroad.
sentences.cn: 这种令人沮丧的经历将很快损害英国高等教育在海外的声誉.

sentences.en: It's very dispiriting for anyone to be out of a job.
sentences.cn: 每个人都会对事业很懊丧。

sentences.en: Our lack of progress is very dispiriting.
sentences.cn: 我们毫无进展真使人气馁.

words.tran_cn: 沮丧的；没有精神的；意气消沉的
使…沮丧；使…气馁（dispirit的过去分词）
令人沮丧的；使人气馁的

trans.tran_cn: 令人沮丧的；使人气馁的
trans.tran_en: Something that is dispiriting causes you to lose your enthusiasm and excitement
